item.title: Global hotkey - Dropdown Terminal on MacOS
item.description: You move from Linux? Miss Dropdown terminal? Looking for alternative on MacOS and can access it anytime and anywhere? item.description: Have you ever faced this scenario where you want to run two or more lightweight services or multiple executables within the same container when the image starts running? item.description: DNS Problem? For DNS nameserver, You may encounter an issue where the dns-nameserver configuration is changed to the address 127.0.0.53 when rebooting Ubuntu Server. item.title: Learning Sed Is Beneficial For Linux Users
item.description: One of the most important command line utility in Linux is sed which is a stream editor. item.title: Xf86 Video Intel
item.description: Why not XF86-Video-Intel ? It is a DDX driver (which provides 2D acceleration in Xorg) but It is not recommended to install nowaday. Because this package is no longer needed and also causes screen tearing. And also the generic xf86-video-modesetting DDX driver included in xorg-server seems to be better than most vendor specific xf86-video- drivers. Some (Debian & Ubuntu, Fedora, KDE) recommend not installing the xf86-video-intel driver, and instead falling back on the modesetting driver for Gen4 and newer GPUs (GMA 3000 from 2006 and newer).

item.title: Shortcode to Insert Raw HTML in Hugo
item.description: Hugo is very good framework of creating a website by using markdown. But there are times when Markdown falls short. Often, content authors are forced to add raw HTML (e.g., video <iframes>) to Markdown content. But Hugo does not seem to have a good way to let you do this in a markdown file. They created shortcodes to circumvent these limitations. A shortcode is a simple snippet inside a content file that Hugo will render using a predefined template.

item.title: Using Arduino With PharoThings/Smalltalk
item.description: Firmata Firmata is a generic protocol for communicating with microcontrollers from software on a host computer. It is intended to work with any host computer software package. Right now there is a matching object in a number of languages. It is easy to add objects for other software to use this protocol. Basically, this firmware establishes a protocol for talking to the Arduino from the host software. The aim is to allow people to completely control the Arduino from software on the host computer.
